statement.p: An aircraft in flight has total energy given by \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{2}}{m}{v}^{{2}}+{m}{g}{h} where
\displaystyle{m} is the mass of the aircraft in pounds
\displaystyle{h} is the height above sea level in feet
Suppose a glider with mass 1170 lbs and initial velocity 92 ft/s is at an altitude of 8,000. ft MSL. If the pilot wants to increase the velocity to 147 ft/s to what altitude must it descend? ft MSL
The initial altitude has four significant digits. Hint: The total energy will be the same before and after the altitude change.
